intro: Erysimum strictum, commonly known as the upright wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces bright yellow or orange flowers in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Erysimum strictum thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
